Articles.Content:
1.2 is now out. It's everything 1.0 should have been, and so much more. But now, SQUAD has acheived most of the sales of the base game it's going to get with the console version. They're a company, and they need money. I think that we should have more games with the Kerbals and Kerbin. What other Kerbal-universe games would you like to see? I think a story-focused game where you are a Kerbal whose plane has crashed and has to survive in the wilderness would be cool. Rant ends.

 

Talk!

Edited October 30, 2016 by OrbitalBuzzsaw

I'd like to see a full flight simulator, where you can build your own air planes like in KSP (including propellers and internal combustion engines); it would have more accurate atmospheric flight dynamics, real weather, airports and scenery, ability to have random failures etc.  It could be more of an expansion pack than a whole separate program.  Hey I can dream can't I?  But I don't think KSP is finished by a long shot. 

A story along the lines you suggest sounds interesting.  How about a game where your kerbals crash their giant space ship onto a deserted planet and then have to start a whole civilization from scratch and (in the fastest possible time) become a space faring civilization so they can go back home (in this scenario Kerbals are basically immortal barring accidents).

Edited October 30, 2016 by kBob

Although KSP hitting Steam's top sellers list again during the 1.2 launch makes me wonder how much their sales are actually suffering, I'll play ball.

A KSP2 is very much likely.  Aside from that, I'd love a Kerbal Cart Racer with a destruction derby mode.  Imagine building up your cart with hundreds of parts and slamming it into another cart made up of another hundred parts!  You'd have to manage your winnings against any damage sustained.  I don't know.  Could be cool.
I'm still waiting for Kerbal Space Program versus the Kerbal Space Random Contract Generator that we have now.

1 hour ago, nosirrbro said:

That's why sandbox/science mode exists

I'm pretty sure neither of those are what he's asking for.
Sim Kerbal.  You run a bunch of research programs and focus on economic development of Kerbin while managing accident prone albeit devoted Kerbals.

Kerbal Research Program where you are a scientist dealing with the Science! that comes back from the Mün.

Kerbal Colonisation Program as it says on the tin. KSP Expansion Pack is probably an EPL around a new star...

I suspect they are lookin at a child's cartoon ala Angry Birds.  Is that called diversification  of the IP? 

Kreb City being a sim city type experience with the sim copter fly throughs?

Edit - ninjad by the above post for Research idea!

Edited October 30, 2016 by theJesuit
Ninja timing

Honestly they could just plop Kerbals into any old game and make something of it. Personally, I think they'll try selling the IP and company like Pearson did with Minecraft after a few more updates, and retire to Patogonia to live like kings.

A strategy game might be nice, something like Kommand and Kerbal- wherein you actually have to colonize and secure territory on Kerbin because, let's face it, the planet is empty save for the KSC and a few other random locations. A good campaign for this RTS might include how the Kerbals use space technology to develop and maintain cities, seeing as they developed spaceships before they did cities and their infrastructure.

5 minutes ago, Maximus97 said:

seeing as they developed spaceships before they did cities and their infrastructure.

Or for that matter, the wheel.

What I feel should be done before Squad decides to develop any other Kerbal-themed games would be that they create a little more background on the Kerbals. What I've wondered about the most are the following:

Cities don't exist on Kerbin because of the hit they would take on performance, but if they did exist, how would they look?

How would Kerbin's landscape really look? Currently, we only see low-res, repetitive ground scatter and a homogeneous-textured surface for terrain.

How do animals look? I remember seeing a kraken-like creature in one of the official animations; how about showing more species?

Edited October 31, 2016 by Rithsom
Colonization sim would be nice. Something like "Sol 0", but done right.

1.2 is now out. It's everything 1.0 should have been, and so much more.

I disagree.

If there is ever going to be a sequel it should be Kerbal Aircraft Program with Earth-sized Kerbin and atmospheric engines of different eras. And with multiplayer. And maybe weapons.

That's a brilliant idea!

How about a Civ clone?

Kerbal Politics: Using the Kerbal approach to strategic weaponry or why there is only KSC left on the planet.

Kerbal Politics: Using the Kerbal approach to strategic weaponry or why there is only KSC left on the planet.

 

Or:  How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the RUD ?

I'd go with:

 

The prequel: Kerbal Aeronautics Program. Same idea as KSP, but starting with early Wright type flying things up to large hypersonic transports. Someone will probably mod a space program on top.

Kerbin: a Telltale Game. I don't particularly like those, but they have a habit of making games out of other games and stuff

Kerbal Space Program: The Movie. (Because, why not? Hopefully Hollywood does something passable with it. And it provides a better opportunity to sell merchandising)

Kerbal Space Program 2 (Hopefully, with upgraded graphics and better designed gameplay)

I would vote for a Space Station or general Kerbal Colony Program where the object was to build up your colony as much as possible, either by building up the infrastructure (ships, supply depots, shuttlecraft) and maintaining your expanse, or take it a half built scenario from the computer and have to make do with what's there until you can launch new components.
No.
I would say KSP-2 on CRYENGINE. That would be a mastepiece.
